newsitem.title: DENMARK: SAS says plans South African alliance.
newsitem.headline: SAS says plans South African alliance.

text.p: Scandinavian Airlines System (SAS) says it plans to form an alliance with South African Airways (SAA) as a foothold on the African continent.
But in an interview published on Monday in the Danish business magazine Economic Weekly, SAS director Curt Lundqvist said the deal would not take effect immediately.
"For the moment talks with the South Africans on, among other things code-sharing are on standby because we are using many resources to develop the other major alliances," he said.
SAS has existing strategic partnersships with Lufthansa, United Airlines, Thai Airways International and Air Canada.
Deregulation has brought the Scandinavian carrier competition on short-haul European services and some domestic routes, notably from British Airways Express and Virgin Express.
Virgin last month announced a code-sharing agreement with South Africa's Sun Air. --Soeren Linding Jakobsen, Copenhagen newsroom +45 33969653
